page.title: 02Tibbs Court Farm Brenchley
page.content: Tibbs Court Farm has 116 acres of {orchards}(110 of apples,6 of pears)and 80 acres of{hops.}It employs 10 full time men, 12 full time local "casual" women and students for apple packing & about 50 extra people for hop-picking. The orchards are tended throughout the year.During the winter trees are pruned and sprayed to kill wintering parasites.In the spring further sprays are used including one to prevent too many apples from setting so that the fruit produced will be a good size. Fruit picking begins in July and continues into November according to the variety.Apples and pears are handled carefully to avoid bruising, they are picked into specially designed bags or bins and then emptied into large bulk containers to be taken by tractor or fork-lift truck to the packhouse or cold store.
